sen.j: 常覚寺（じょうかくじ）は、奈良県五條市（旧吉野郡西吉野村）にある高野山真言宗の寺院。
sen.e: Jokaku-ji Temple is a Koyasan Shingon sect temple located in Gojo City, Nara Prefecture (former Nishiyoshino Village, Yoshino County).
Jokaku-ji Temple is a Koyasan Shingon sect temple located in Gojo City, Nara Prefecture (former Nishiyoshino Village, Yoshino County).
Jokaku-ji Temple is a Koyasan Shingon sect temple located in Gojo City, Nara Prefecture (former Nishiyoshino Village, Yoshino County).
The sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple, is Enmeizan.
sen.cmt: 延命山はEnmeizanかEnmeisanか不明のため、Enmeizanとしてあります。
sen.e: The sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple, is Enmeizan.
The sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple, is Enmeizan.
The principal image of Buddha is Fugen Enmei Bosatsu.
The principal image of Buddha is Fugen Enmei Bosatsu.
The principal image of Buddha is Fugen Enmei Bosatsu.

sen.j: 普賢さんの名で親しまれる。
sen.e: It is commonly known as Fugen-san.
This image is commonly known as Fugen-san.
This image is commonly known as Fugen-san.
History
History
History

sen.j: この寺は、寺伝によれば平安時代初期空海の開山により創建されたという。
sen.e: This temple is said to have been founded by Kukai according to the temple legend.
According to temple legend, it is said to have been founded at the start of the Heian Period by the monk Kukai.
sen.cmt: Heian Periodを挿入し、Kukai>the monk Kukai.
sen.e: According to temple legend, it is said to have been founded at the start of the Heian Period by the monk Kukai.
